instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.GPUVCORE_EN: What is GPUVCORE_EN? GPUVCORE_EN enables GPU VCORE when it is high, a power rail necessary for the GPU to function so you can get an image on the screen. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15” Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS: What is PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS? PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor to components that create power rails for the GPU. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>....yeah I just want YOUR opinion on what to do
threads.message: I got this in today. Board turns on and chimes has no image on the screen. I opened the bottom lid and saw THIS. How should I proceed? (You can be explicit too because this kinda pissed me off when I opened it lol)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>....yeah I just want YOUR opinion on what to do
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>....yeah I just want YOUR opinion on what to do
threads.message: Clean it up and replace corroded resistors and traces. Not much else I can say before that is done.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>....yeah I just want YOUR opinion on what to do
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>....yeah I just want YOUR opinion on what to do
threads.message: Ok so back to this mess. Replaced corroded resistors/burned caps near that area and reflowed <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>. Now I have a green light and 1.5 volts on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>... The only thing on the entire board getting any heat when I connect the charger is the GPU. It's not insanely hot, but it is getting warm.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>....yeah I just want YOUR opinion on what to do
threads.message: And the light is kinda intermittent not really stable. 3.42 volts on 3v42 tho

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>....yeah I just want YOUR opinion on what to do
threads.message:
PPDCIN: 18
CHGR ACIN: 4.36
Resistance between 17 and 18 2.9 ohms
27 and 28 22.3 ohms

PPBUS is 1.5 so would this be an ISL issue now?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>....yeah I just want YOUR opinion on what to do
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>....yeah I just want YOUR opinion on what to do
threads.message: <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR> is now shorted sending 12V to the GPU. <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> is dead for sure and <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR> too. Could have been caused by corroded traces and whatever you did to the area around <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>. Pray that the GPU survived......

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>....yeah I just want YOUR opinion on what to do
threads.message: Fuuuuuck ok. Are there more transistors I should replace along with it to avoid anything else from happening?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>....yeah I just want YOUR opinion on what to do
threads.message: Why not replace all the FETs and <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>. Also need to figure out why it shorted. Corroded traces and resistors can cause this, so double check everything.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>....yeah I just want YOUR opinion on what to do
threads.message: Ok was thinking that on the fets. I’m gonna go with possibly the gigantic chunks of ground plane burnt off the board causing the issue but not sure so will check

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>....yeah I just want YOUR opinion on what to do
threads.message: Ok so pulled fets and <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>. Underneath where <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR> was the transistor fell apart, but the board does not look bad at all like no explosion or burned layers or anything. Also pulling them relieved a short on <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS</SIGNAL> Ordered chips and mosfets, so fingers crossed the GPU is not dead lol

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>....yeah I just want YOUR opinion on what to do
threads.message: Replaced fets and ISL and got power back but no video internally or externally GPU got 12 volts the end :(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>....yeah I just want YOUR opinion on what to do
threads.message: GPU power ok now? Not that hard to replace GPU/VRAM on these.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>....yeah I just want YOUR opinion on what to do
threads.message: I don't have the resources for replacing the GPU unfortunately if I did then I would def try it if you think it's not too bad. GPU power appeared to be ok definitely not shorted to ground fan spins, chimes, but absolutely no video even with a known good screen or plugged in externally.
